Detailed Description

Class reading a YAML file.

Class ParserYAML is oriented recursively it is capable of reading YAML formatted files verify scenes, and create scenes

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ParserYAML::ParserYAML ( std::string  filename  ) 

Constructor.

Constructor of ParserYAML Opens the file stream and verify YAML syntax.

Parameters:
filename : file to be opened

Member Function Documentation

static bool ParserYAML::already_searched ( std::string  filename  )  [inline, static]

Prevents recursive calls from deadlocking.

Parameters:
filename : the file to be opened next
bool ParserYAML::check_all (  ) 

Verifies everything but SCENE section in the file.

This is the principal exploration function It browses every section and even the other files specified in the LOADING section.

bool ParserYAML::check_loadings (  ) 

Browse new files specified in the LOADING section.

This function opens the research of items to new files specified in the LOADING section.

bool ParserYAML::check_scene (  ) 

Verifies the scene of the file (MASTER file).

Verifies that the scene specified in the main file really describes a scene, and that everything was found in the files.

bool ParserYAML::check_section ( std::string  section  ) 

Verifies a section.

This function verifies that given a section, everything is in order (parameters...).

Parameters:
section : the concerned section (OBJECTS,LIGHTS,...)
bool ParserYAML::check_texture ( std::string  object_name  ) 

Verifies the texture of a given object exists.

Verifies the texture attached to an object really exists somewhere in the files.

Parameters:
object_name : the concerned object's name

Parameters:

Creates a camera.

boost::shared_ptr< Shape > ParserYAML::create_object ( std::string  object_name,
std::map< std::string, Texture * > &  texture_map 
)

Creates an object.

Creates the shape corresponding to object_name It must be sure when calling this function that the object lies in this file Also calls the create_texture() function to allocate its texture.

Parameters:
object_name : the object's name
texture_map : a map of already created texture not to create useless duplicates.
Texture * ParserYAML::create_texture ( std::string  texture_name  ) 

Creates a texture.

Creates the texture corresponding to texture_name It must be sure when calling this function that the texture lies in this file.

Parameters:
texture_name : the texture's name
Scene ParserYAML::generate_scene (  )  [virtual]

Creates the Scene described in the file.

Creates the scene corresponding to the SCENE section described in the file This function must only be used after a successfull call to is_well_formed().

Implements Parser< YAML::Node >.

bool ParserYAML::is_volume ( std::string  object_name  ) 

Returns whether a shape is a volume or not.

Verifies that the given object is a volume.

Parameters:
object_name : the concerned object's name
bool ParserYAML::is_well_formed (  )  [virtual]

Verifies the parameters of everything in the files (recursively).

Verifies everything, the return value indicated whether it is possible to generate the scene or not This function is called only in the main parser (not recursive).

Implements Parser< YAML::Node >.

void ParserYAML::param_init (  )  [static]

Initialize the tree of parameters.

Creates the tree of parameter for any type of things in the scene it is a practical way to browser parameter and sum them up.
